input_str:
JP Morgan could be "complicit", by omission -ignoring signs of potential fraud -- as well as by commission, according to white collar lawyers I have consulted today.

It did not have to be an active partner in the Ponzi Scheme to be found guilty of a civil liability, lawyers say. Rather, the bank's omission would be ignoring several red flags -- troublesome signs of potential fraud -- and never investigating their accuracy or meaning. The bank did not fulfill its requirement to investigate Madoff fully and so could be found to be compliant in
